verses.text: Mind precedes all mental states. Mind is their chief; they are all mind-wrought. If with an impure mind a person speaks or acts suffering follows him like the wheel that follows the foot of the ox.
Mind precedes all mental states. Mind is their chief; they are all mind-wrought. If with a pure mind a person speaks or acts happiness follows him like his never-departing shadow.

If you do not get a prudent companion who is fit and wise to live with, then like a king who leaves behind a conquered kingdom, or like a lone elephant in the elephant forest, you should go alone. There is no fellowship with a fool.
Better than a thousand useless words is one useful word, hearing which one attains peace.
